answers.answer: Well that really depends on a lot of factors. Babies size, your size, if you tear naturally or are cut, etc etc. I know some women who have had 100+ stitches and had surgery to fix down there while others have none. I personally had 2 tiny tears and 6 stitches. Childbirth is painful, I won't lie. For me, it was the worst pain I've ever felt but I also had back labour as well. It just depends on the female.
What are the chances in ripping at 16 jw
Almost every female will tear. Because your body isn't even mature yet it might make it harder. The teenage body is not meant to be giving birth and is a lot more stressful on it.

I know it's hard but try not to worry about the birth-all you have to remember is what you will get at the end of it.I'm not going to lie birth is unbelievably painful-I went natural but remember there are so many meds out there you can have. With regards to stitches it depends on so many things but generally if you do exactly what your midwife tells you, you will be fine.Think how many women go through birth every day & think how many of those go on to have more children!!Please lovely just enjoy your pregnancy-& think about how great you're going to feel with your beautiful baby in your arms.I'm here if you ever want to chatFreya xx

Ags doesnt really matter.  U r pregnant for nine months in order to allow ur bidy to prepare for delivery. My first child. Tore me just a little. I had like two stitches.  I didnt even feel them being put in.   My second one didnt tear me at all.    As far as giving birth.  U have to decide if u r gettin meds or not.  If u cant tolerate pain its a good ideA to talk to ur dr about the epidural.   Or other pain relievers.  They will try to make u as comfortable as possible.
And as far as being too young. Women where ment to bare children. My sister was 14 when she gave birth to her first child. She didjust fine.Having good moral support in ur room makes wonders.

Yes they are, but body maturing does help quite a bit. A 14 year old isn't done growing versus a 25 year old who is. Just because your sister did fine DOES NOT mean others will. It's a fact that pregnancy is harder on a teenagers body.

Never said it wasnt.  But honestly there is no point i believe to scare someone that may or maynot have complications.  this is a day and age where younger and younger people are becoming pregnant. And doctors have to become better prepared for that.      Giving confidence is my way of support. Considering i also am a young mother pregnant with her 3rd child at the age of 22.

I agree. Why scare someone? You don't know her situation so I think all we can do is generally comment & give her support.The main thing to remember is why we go through birth & that is to meet our beautiful child! Nothing compares.

It's not a scare, it's a fact. And I did give fact. Just because pregnancy is happening younger (which I will not comment on) does NOT mean the body is still prepared for it.Education is key. There's no point to sugar coat reality.
Omg I'm only 16 I'm so not ready for birth I havnt even had a lot of sex :/ cant I just have a c-section :'(

C-section is major surgery and you add a whole load of other risks. Infection, the incision ripping open, not to mention you'll likely need another c-section in the future. This isn't to say this will happen, but it can. You also likely will not see the baby once it's born either because you'll be in a recovery room.It doesn't matter how old you are, YOU made the choice for sex-- and the purpose of sex is to reproduce. Talk to others, and more importantly talk to others. It's not all doom and gloom, but it's also not a cake walk.

C-section is not the answer. It's so much more dangerous & you will be out of action for 6 weeks.I promise you will be fine-you can do this, it's what our bodies were made for & you will be surprised just how much you can cope with!You can do what ever you put your mind to & you have the biggest insentive!You CAN do it, I promise.
If stitches worry u dont get a c section hun.  U will be in the hospital longer and its more painful afterward.

Age does matter in regards to pregnancy for many, many reasons. Women who get pregnant in their early to mid teens are at risk for complications such as preeclampsia, gestational diabetes, failed labor, and emergency cesarean sections. Some of those complications can be dangerous for both mother and baby. That's not a scare tactic, it's a fact that any OB/GYN or midwife will attest to. Just because you can get pregnant at an early age, doesn't mean your body is ready to. One woman's labor and delivery/pregnancy has no bearing on another woman's.Whether or not you tear depends on a great many things as well. But in general, most women tear. I had a 2nd degree tear and my epidural only worked on one side. I also had horrific back labor. I felt myself tearing and afterwards I was in a lot of pain and was swollen very badly and bruised. But, just because I tore and had a lot of pain doesn't mean you will. Delivery isn't made to be a cake walk, it does hurt.Cesarean section is a major abdominal surgery and most doctor's will not perform an elective c-section unless you've had a previous c-section. Also, most insurances will not cover an elective cesarean if you do find a doctor to perform one.
It's really not that bad as it sounds.

question: How bad will it hurt wheb I give birth how many stiches will I have to get? Please inform me before I give birth.
title: please give me info
